channel.title: Better way of doing this?

item.title: Better way of doing this?
item.dc:creator: @Itachi_Uchiha Itachi Uchiha
item.description:
@Itachi_Uchiha wrote:

Alright, so I need help with areas since I am not really that good at them…Is there a way in return booleans that I can make an area within the return not be called while still using the same as !=<, ect.
Is there anything that can replace certain areas of this that will improve it? (I know there is…)
Also any other input to this would be great
[Don’t say anything about getting rid of commands and make it run on its own because I am already working on that as we speak…er…Type and read…Yeah…That… It loads values from the random method in the Misc Class and then sets them to true and to false after the method is called again the next 5min.]

Lumby method in weather class:

public void lumbridgeWarning(Player p) { EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(new Event() { @Override public void execute(EventContainer event) { for (Player pl : Engine.players) { if(pl != null) { if (Lumbridge) { pl.frames.sendMessage(pl, "[<col=0000FF><shad=1>NWS</shad></col>][<col=0000FF>Broadcast</col>] A <col=FFF000><shad=1>Severe Thunderstorm Warning</shad></col> is in effect for Lumbridge."); } else { event.stop(); } } } //event.stop(); } }, 30000); // Calls the sendmessage every 30 seconds }

AREAS!
Like I mentioned before, I need help with how exactly to implement this…ATM I am building the area around houses…

public boolean lumbridgeStorm() { return parameterJ >= 3217 && parameterJ <= 3228 && parameterK >= 3204 && parameterK <= 3238 || parameterJ >= 3221 && parameterJ <= 3225 && parameterK >= 3239 && parameterK <= 3241 || parameterJ >= 3221 && parameterJ <= 3232 && parameterK >= 3242 && parameterK <= 3251; }

In Walking Class
This! I need help with the most. I need to find a better class than this because this updates every time I click an area, not when I stumble into an area.

if (p.lumbridgeStorm()) { if (Engine.weather.Lumbridge) { p.frames.showInterface(p, 422); p.appearanceUpdateReq = true; p.updateReq = true; } } if (p.faladorStorm()) { if (Engine.weather.Falador) { p.frames.showInterface(p, 481); p.appearanceUpdateReq = true; p.updateReq = true; } }

Finaly…Commands, this is the grand controller. O.o…

String cityFalador = "Falador"; String warning = "<col=FF0000><shad=1>WARNING</shad></col>"; String advisory = "<col=0000FF><shad=1>ADVISORY</shad></col>"; String stormType1 = "<col=FFFFF0><shad=1>Snow Storm</shad></col>"; String cityLumbridge = "Lumbridge"; String stormType2 = "<col=FFF000><shad=1>ThunderStorm</shad></col>"; for (Player pl : Engine.players) { if(pl != null) { if (cmd[0].equals("faladoron")) { Engine.weather.Falador = true; Engine.weather.faladorWarning(p); pl.frames.sendMessage(pl, "[" + warning + "] A large, hazardous " + stormType1 + " has moved toward " + cityFalador +"!"); pl.frames.sendMessage(pl, "[" + advisory + "] Please evacuate the " + cityFalador + " District, or move to an inside area imediately!"); } else if (cmd[0].equals("faladoroff")) { Engine.weather.Falador = false; pl.frames.sendMessage(pl, "[" + advisory + "] The storm in <col=00FF00>Falador</col> has ended."); } else if (cmd[0].equals("lumbridgeon")) { Engine.weather.Lumbridge = true; Engine.weather.lumbridgeWarning(p); pl.frames.sendMessage(pl, "[" + warning + "] A large " + stormType2 + " has moved toward " + cityLumbridge + "!"); pl.frames.sendMessage(pl, "[" + advisory + "] Please evacuate " + cityLumbridge + ", or move to an inside area imediately!"); } else if (cmd[0].equals("lumbridgeoff")) { Engine.weather.Lumbridge = false; pl.frames.sendMessage(pl, "[" + advisory + "] The storm in the " + cityLumbridge + " District has ended."); } } }

I don’t need to post anything else because all of the rest I have covered

Read full topic
